name: hexafluoroethane production, from fluorination of tetrafluoroethane | hexafluoroethane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4763/documentation

Production of  hexafluoroethane by means of the fluorination of tetrafluoroethane The reaction yield is 95%  based on literature. Infrastructure, energy and cooling water inputs are estimated due to lack of data. The system includes the process with consumption of raw materials, energy, and infrastructure. Since the emissions are of chemicals of some toxicity, and due to lack of process data, they are assumed to be  recycled internally and have been not considered in the emissions.

From the reception of tetrafluoroethane and fluorine at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of hexafluoroethane including materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: the chemical reaction is valid in the global context
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The present inventory describes the process of producing hexafluoroethane which comprises reacting a hydrofluorocarbon (tetrafluoroethane) containing 2 carbon atoms, with fluorine gas at an elevated temperature (200-500Â°C) in a vapor phase (0 to 3 MPa) in the presence of a diluent gas. The diluent gas preferably comprises at least one of tetrafluoromethane, hexafluroroethane and hydrogen fluoride, and is preferably rich in hydrogen fluoride. This reaction is also possible with pentafluoroethane, but  tetrafluoroethane is preferable.                                                 The reaction is the following:   CF3CH2F + 2F2  = CF3CF3 + 2HF
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is an estimation based on literature data and basic principles of chemical engineering.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: This dataset is an estimation based on literature data and basic principles of chemical engineering.

exchanges.description: values for electricity and heat have been approximated with data from a large chemical site in Germany producing 2.05Mt/y (intermediates included) of different chemicals. This plant uses 3.2MJ per kg of product. All energy needed for heat or steam is assumed to be natural gas. Of the total energy input, it is assumed 2 MJ/kg as heat and 1.2 MJ/kg as electricity.

defaultProvider.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

exchanges.description: The value is approximated from the chemical plant sites in Gendorf (Germany) and from the BASF site of Ludwigshafen (Germany). On the Gendorf site 12 companies produce 1500 different end products with a total amount 1.25 Mt each year and in the BASF site 9.1 Mt per year. The production in both sites cover many different (mainly organic) chemical processes. The plant lifetime is considered 50 years and the production capacity 50,000 tones per year.
